channel.title: Cinema IRL
channel.description: Movies give us countless scenarios and situations the characters have to navigate. Well, how would YOU handle these situations in you were in their place? Amber, Scott and the occasional guest tackle this very topic. We're not a review show, but there are enough opinions between us you'll get a little of that too. We mostly try to keep it lighthearted and funny. Sometimes we succeed, sometimes not so much, but it's usually entertaining nonetheless.

item.title: E193 - Eden - What Would YOU Do?
item.description: Forget paradise, this "Eden" is a godforsaken island where civilization's castoffs create their own brand of hell. Expect backstabbing, murder, and questionable hygiene as a group of outsiders devolve into a primal struggle for survival.

item.title: E192 - Trust - What Would You NOT Do?
item.description: Amber and Scott dive into "Trust," a thriller where a disgraced Hollywood starlet's remote cabin getaway turns into a horrifying fight for survival. They unpack the questionable decisions, the plot contrivances, and the absolutely baffling escape attempts, all while trying to recover from the movie's audacity.

item.title: E189 - Americana - What Would YOU Do?
item.description: Amber and Scott discuss "Americana," a crime thriller centered around the theft of a priceless Native American ghost shirt. The film follows a waitress and a veteran as they pursue the stolen artifact, encountering violence, cultural clashes, and unexpected twists along the way. Their journey involves a surprisingly good child actor, a loveable but impulsive veteran, and a darkly comedic look at cultural appropriation. The discussion includes lively debate on the film's themes and memorable scenes.

item.title: E188 - Weapons - What Would YOU Do?

The hosts debate the film's strengths and weaknesses, engaging in their signature "What Would You Do?" segments about the film's various unsettling scenarios.

item.title: E165 - 28 Years Later - What Would YOU Do?
item.description: This week on Cinema IRL, it's just Scott and Jimmy as they dissect "28 Years Later"... without Amber's calming influence. Scott struggles to keep the show on the rails as they delve into the rage-filled world of the "R" virus zombies. Jimmy, our resident zombie expert, draws sharp distinctions between the "R" virus and his own "T" virus, leading to some surprisingly philosophical and hilarious debates. They discuss the movie's questionable plot points, like zombie safaris and pregnant zombies, and delve into the ethics of human-zombie relations. Plus, Jimmy gives his *very* strong opinions on the Alpha zombies. What is it? Find out now on Cinema IRL!

item.title: E163 - I Don't Understand You - What Would YOU Do?
item.description: Ciao, chaos! This week on Cinema IRL, we're diving headfirst into the dark, darkly comedic Italian nightmare that is "I Don't Understand You." Dom and Cole, a loving couple on the cusp of adoption, find their anniversary trip to Italy spiraling out of control faster than you can say "oopsie-daisy" after accidentally killing a dinner host. Get ready for a hilarious dissection of escalating bad decisions, cultural misunderstandings, and the age-old question: what *would* you do if you accidentally became a murderer on vacation? From language barriers to multiple accidental deaths, we're tackling all the absurdities, and of course, judging their questionable choices every step of the way. Plus, we unpack *that* vegetarian scene... *shudders*.

item.title: E162 - The Phoenician Scheme - What Would YOU Do?
item.description: Welcome back to Cinema IRL, where we dive deep into films and ask the important questions... like, what *is* "the gap" in international finance? This week, were unraveling the stylishly bizarre and utterly baffling world of *The Phoenician Scheme* (Episode 163). Picture this: a family business, corporate intrigue, and enough assassination attempts to make James Bond blush. But trust us, the official synopsis doesn't even scratch the surface of this star-studded cinematic enigma. Buckle up as we dissect the plot, ponder moral dilemmas, and try to figure out just what *The Phoenician Scheme* is actually about. Is it a miss or a hidden gem? Let's find out!

item.title: E159 - Bring Her Back - What Would YOU Do?
item.description:
Get ready for a wild ride, folks! This week on Cinema IRL, we dive deep into the unsettling world of "Bring Her Back." A brother and sister stumble upon a disturbing ritual at their new foster home, involving necromancy, body parts, and a desperate attempt to resurrect the foster mother's deceased daughter.

Was it a zombie film? A vampire flick? Or something far more sinister involving dark arts? Join our hosts as they dissect the film's gory details, debate its genre, and grapple with the moral quandary at its heart: Would you sacrifice another life to bring back a loved one? Be warned: this episode is not for the faint of heart!

Get ready for a wild ride, folks! This week on Cinema IRL, we dive deep into the unsettling world of "Bring Her Back." A brother and sister stumble upon a disturbing ritual at their new foster home, involving necromancy, body parts, and a desperate attempt to resurrect the foster mother's deceased daughter.

Was it a zombie film? A vampire flick? Or something far more sinister involving dark arts? Join our hosts as they dissect the film's gory details, debate its genre, and grapple with the moral quandary at its heart: Would you sacrifice another life to bring back a loved one? Be warned: this episode is not for the faint of heart!

item.title: E157 - Jane Austen Wrecked My Life - What Would YOU Do?
item.description: Welcome back to Cinema IRL! This week, we're diving headfirst into the awkward world of French rom-coms with "Jane Austen Wrecked My Life." A struggling bookseller, a writer's retreat run by Jane Austen's distant relatives, and a whole lot of romantic confusion what could possibly go wrong? Our hosts dissect this film's messy love triangles, questionable decisions, and the age-old debate of whether men and women can truly be "just friends." Get ready for some seriously relatable "What Would You Do?" scenarios, language barrier faux pas, and a discussion about the ethics of drunk sex (yes, really!). Tune in for a hilarious and thought-provoking conversation that will leave you questioning all your life choices.

item.title: E156 - Final Destination Bloodlines - What Would YOU Do?
item.description: Death is coming, and this time it's personal...ly gruesome! This week on Cinema IRL, we dive headfirst (sometimes literally) into "Final Destination: Bloodlines." We discuss Stephanie's family curse, inherited from a grandmother plagued by premonitions. Is Iris crazy, or is she the only one who can outsmart Death himself? We ponder the film's elaborate death traps, debate abandoning cursed families, and ask the important questions: peanut allergy or metal coil through the head? Plus, are there enough warning signs before someone goes out for cigarettes and never returns? Get ready to suspend your disbelief and brace yourself for some epicly creative carnage!

item.title: E155 - Lilo & Stitch - What Would YOU Do?
item.description: Aloha, Cinema IRL Ohana! This week, we're hanging ten with Disney's "Lilo & Stitch," a story about a lonely Hawaiian girl and a chaotic, destructive, yet ultimately lovable alien experiment. Join us as we unpack the film's themes of family, belonging, and "Ohana means nobody gets left behind or forgotten." We dive deep into the ethical dilemmas presented, from Nani's questionable life-saving decisions to the very nature of Stitch's destructive programming. Plus, we contemplate what *we* would do if a blue "dog" with a penchant for chaos showed up in our lives. Get ready for some serious laughter, portal gun debates, and maybe even a scream or two. Ahhhhh!

item.title: E154 - The Ruse - What Would YOU Do?
item.description: Welcome back to Cinema IRL! This week, we dive deep into "The Ruse," a thriller that throws more red herrings than a seafood market. Was it the creepy neighbor? The pervy delivery guy? Or maybe even... a ghost? Join us as we dissect the film's plot holes, questionable character choices (seriously, Dale, inviting strangers in?), and the complete lack of "terrifying supernatural occurrences" promised in the description. We also debate the ethics of home health agencies and whether Dale's boyfriend deserves a spot on "Days of Our Lives." Buckle up for a wild ride filled with plot twists, questionable romance, and a whole lot of "what would you do?" scenarios.

item.title: E153 - Rosario - What Would YOU Do?
item.description: When a desperate mother makes a deal with a shadowy corporation to save her son, the Cinema IRL hosts dive into "Rosario," a film where the cure might be worse than the disease. They dissect the high-stakes world of black-market cures and corporate assassins, questioning if you should ever trust a company whose business model seems to be "miracles with a body count." Also, Scott rails on bad writing pertaining to the investment market, because OF COURSE he does.

item.title: E152 - Sinners - What Would YOU Do?
item.description:
This week on Cinema IRL, we're diving into a movie that's part plantation drama, part musical, and ALL vampire horror! That's right, we're tackling a film where sinners seeking a fresh start find themselves facing a bloodthirsty horde.

To help us separate Hollywood fact from fiction, we're joined by a very special guest: Von Murder, a real-life, 769-year-old vampire! Von Murder sets the record straight on everything from garlic and crosses to the proper way to stake a vamp. Get ready for a wild ride as we dissect this cinematic oddity with a true creature of the night.

item.title: E151 - Hurry Up Tomorrow - What Would YOU Do?
item.description: Buckle up, listeners, because this week's episode is a wild ride... or maybe just a confusing one. We bravely (or foolishly) dove into a film starring The Weeknd as, well, The Weeknd a musician whose life takes a bizarre turn after a chance encounter. One minute he's on tour, the next he's tied to a bed in a hotel room. What follows is a chaotic blend of obsession, arson, and questionable decision-making, leaving us scratching our heads. Join us as we try to unravel what exactly happened in this movie, and debate what we'd do if we were caught in this cinematic fever dream.

item.title: E150 - Watch The Skies - What Would YOU Do?
item.description: This week, Amber and Scott tackle a UFO thriller that proves the truth really is out there - and it's probably more traumatic than you'd expect. When a young girl's father gets abducted by aliens and replaced with someone else, our hosts dive into the age-old question: what's worse, losing your dad to extraterrestrials or having to explain that to your therapist later? Swedish alien hunters are apparently on display, because nothing says 'credible UFO investigation' quite like Nordic efficiency. Grab your tinfoil hat and your skepticism - you'll need both for this close encounter.

item.title: E149 - The Accountant 2 - What Would YOU Do?

This week they're asking the important questions: Is your accountant missing out on being a killer, and are you missing out on way more than just tax write-offs? Spoiler alert: if your accountant can't beat the crap out of anyone who does you wrong, you might want to shop around.

item.title: E148 - Friendship - What Would YOU Do?
item.description: mber and Scott dive into the uncomfortable truth about adult friendships with a film that's basically a masterclass in social awkwardness. As they discuss, if you don't have friends by the time you're an adult, you're probably screwed - but this movie suggests that making new ones might be even worse. When suburban dad Craig's attempts to make an adult male friend spiral completely out of control, our hosts explore why friendship as a grown-up is such a real challenge. Sometimes you take what you can get, but don't be too weird about it - because as this film shows, it can be easy come, easy go.

item.title: E147 - Fight or Flight - What Would YOU Do?
item.description: Amber and Scott tackle an airplane battle royale mashup that somehow manages to cram assassins, flight attendants, and tech bros into one gloriously chaotic action-comedy. Because nothing says 'relaxing flight' quite like a plane full of killers with questionable weapon-smuggling skills and even more questionable survival instincts. Our hosts dive into the important questions: How exactly did all these assassins get weapons on board, and why does every airplane movie seem to think there's a service elevator at 30,000 feet? Buckle up for this high-altitude discussion that's more turbulent than the movie itself.

item.title: E146 - Thunderbolts* - What Would YOU Do?
item.description: Amber and Scott are up for some reject superheroes after diving into Marvel's latest team of misfits who probably got kicked out of the good superhero groups for a reason. That mysterious asterisk in the title remains unexplained because, as our hosts admit, it didn't come up - but hey, at least someone had to type it. This week they're exploring what happens when you take all the B-list heroes and villains and throw them together, probably hoping they'll figure out how to save the world without destroying it first. Spoiler alert: the jury's still out on that one.

item.title: E145 - The Surfer - What Would YOU Do?
item.description: Amber and Scott discuss The Surfer, where Nicholas Cage is full-on Nicholas Caging harder than ever - and yes, it's exactly what you probably think. When a man returns to his beachside hometown in Australia and gets humiliated by local surfers claiming ownership over the beach, things escalate wildly out of control in true Cage fashion. Our hosts explore what happens when childhood wounds, territorial surfers, and peak Nicolas Cage energy collide at the edge of sanity. What the hell was that? Even they're not entirely sure, but that's half the fun.

item.title: E144 - Warfare - What Would YOU Do?
item.description: Amber and Scott take on a very real and unflinching look at modern warfare through the eyes of soldiers who lived it, because sometimes the most important stories are the ones that make us the most uncomfortable. Written and directed by Iraq War veteran Jay Mendoza and Alex Garland, this film embeds audiences with a platoon of American Navy SEALs in an Iraqi family's home during a real-time operation. Our hosts grapple with putting themselves in the shoes of those who've experienced the unthinkable, exploring how war is hell and probably even worse than most of us can imagine. This isn't your typical action movie - it's a visceral, boots-on-the-ground story told like never before.

item.title: E143 - Until Dawn - What Would YOU Do?
item.description: Special guest Jimmy joins Amber and Scott to tackle a horror film that asks the ultimate question: are you scared of dying, especially if you knew you'd just restart the night a little more screwed up than before? When a group finds themselves stalked by a masked killer and horrifically murdered one by one, only to wake up back at the beginning of the same evening, our hosts explore the psychological nightmare of being trapped in a deadly time loop. Jimmy adds his unique perspective as they discuss what happens when your worst night becomes your eternal night. Sometimes the real horror isn't dying - it's having to live through the same terror indefinitely until you're too broken to continue.

item.title: E142 - The Shrouds - What would YOU do?
item.description: Amber and Scott discover that death and technology don't mix particularly well after watching a film about a tech entrepreneur who's developed software that lets the bereaved witness their loved ones' decomposition process. Because apparently, someone thought what grief really needed was a live stream of decay with premium subscription features. Our hosts dive into this premise that had so much potential but was executed about as well as the people being monitored. When you have lots of money, tech skills, and a bit of creepiness, this is apparently how you handle loss - and it's exactly as disturbing as it sounds.

item.title: E141 - The Wedding Banquet - What would YOU do?
item.description: Amber and Scott navigate the complex world of chosen family, cultural identity, and accidental pregnancy in a film that combines a staged straight wedding with some very real complications. When trying to get pregnant, accidentally getting pregnant, and doing this within the context of gay couples creates one really messed up situation, our hosts explore how love, immigration, and family expectations can create the most beautifully chaotic scenarios. Sometimes the best families are the ones you choose, even when those choices involve green card marriages, commitment-phobic boyfriends, and surprise pregnancies that nobody saw coming.

item.title: E139 - The Amateur - What Would YOU Do?
item.description: Amber and Scott prove that nerdy guys can definitely kick some ass when needed, especially when you kill their wife and they decide to come after you. Charlie Heller is a brilliant but deeply introverted CIA decoder whose life gets turned upside down when his wife dies in a London terrorist attack, and when his supervisors refuse to take action, he takes matters into his own hands. Our hosts explore what happens when a tech guy who normally avoids physicality suddenly has all bets off and a very specific set of skills to deploy. Sometimes the quiet ones are the ones you really need to worry about.

item.title: E138 - Disney's Snow White - What Would YOU Do?
item.description: Amber and Scott tackle the classic Disney tale and see if they can make this G-rated story lose its family-friendly rating through sheer force of commentary. What are you looking for here - insight into a movie originally released in 1937 that everyone already knows? Our hosts discuss this reimagining where Snow White flees from the evil queen, finds refuge with seven dwarves, and gets protected by a commoner and his group of woodland bandits when palace guards come looking. Sometimes even the most innocent fairy tales can get a little more interesting with the right perspective.

item.title: E137 - Sacramento - What Would YOU Do?
item.description: Amber and Scott have a nice lively debate over which awful friend is more awful after watching a film about the world's most impulsive road trip. When Anne doesn't just impulsively drive from Los Angeles to Sacramento - that's a long-ass drive, especially when your friend is bringing you along for baby mama moral support - things get complicated fast. Our hosts dive into the messy dynamics of friendship, pregnancy scares, and questionable life choices that somehow all converge in California's capital city. Sometimes the real journey isn't the miles you drive, but the friendships you question along the way.

item.title: E136 - Drop - What Would YOU Do?
item.description: Amber and Scott tackle a first date thriller that proves sometimes you really do want to kill the other person - just not usually on the first date. When Violet, a widowed mother, goes to an upscale restaurant to meet Henry, her charming and handsome date, her pleasant evening quickly turns into a living nightmare when she receives phone messages from a mysterious figure. Our hosts explore what happens when discussing the ways you're planning on killing someone becomes more than just dark humor. Sometimes the best icebreaker is also the most terrifying conversation starter.

Sometimes the real monsters aren't hiding in the woods - they're the ones running the activities.

item.title: E134 - The Friend - What Would YOU Do?
item.description: Amber and Scott discuss what happens when your best friend offs himself and leaves you with one hell of a surprise - a 150-pound Great Dane in your New York City apartment. When Iris finds her comfortable solitary life thrown into complete disarray after her closest friend and mentor bequeaths her his beloved massive dog, our hosts explore the chaos of unexpected giant pets in urban living. Sometimes the most meaningful inheritances are also the most impractical ones, and good luck dealing with that in a tiny apartment.

item.title: E133 - The Luckiest Man in America - What Would YOU Do?
item.description: Amber and Scott dive into the compelling true story of the infamous Michael Larson, who figured out how to game the Press Your Luck game show in 1984 with a number of ridiculous things thrown in along the way. When someone discovers the patterns behind what's supposed to be random and turns it into the ultimate winning strategy, our hosts explore whether he was brilliant or just incredibly observant. Sometimes the luckiest man in America isn't lucky at all - he's just smart enough to see what everyone else missed.

item.title: E132 - The Woman In the Yard - What Would YOU Do?
item.description: A silent, creepy figure in a black dress on your front lawn what's your move? In 'The Woman In the Yard,' this unsettling presence sparks fear and mystery. Amber and Scott confront this unnerving scenario head-on. Would you investigate, call the cops, or just move out? We explore our IRL reactions to this suburban nightmare, from pure panic to potential (and probably ill-advised) bravery. #TheWomanInTheYard #Horror #Thriller #CreepyEncounters #WhatWouldYouDo

Sometimes the most unbelievable part isn't the unicorn - it's what people are willing to do with it.

item.title: Episode 110 - Heart Eyes
item.description: On this episode of Cinema IRL, the hosts dissect the horror-comedy Heart Eyes, a film where a fake kiss unfortunately gets two coworkers placed on a Valentine's Day killer's hit list. This leads to a hilarious roast of the characters' bafflingly poor choices, from their questionable escape tactics to complaining about being "ditched" mid-chase. The hosts even find themselves rooting for the killer to dispatch one particularly obnoxious couple, proving that sometimes the most horrifying part of a movie is the characters themselves.

item.title: Episode 109 - Flight Risk
item.description: On their podcast "Cinema IRL," the hosts tackle the thriller "Flight Risk," where an air marshal's simple prisoner transport becomes a nightmare when the pilot is revealed to be a henchman. This prompts a spirited debate on the proper sky-high protocol for when you have one too many bad guys on your plane. Between questioning the logistics of stabbing-related first aid and one host's deep suspicion of a suspiciously charming radio pilot, the episode is a masterclass in cinematic second-guessing.

item.title: Episode 108 - Brave the Dark
item.description: In a uniquely personal episode, the Cinema IRL podcast discusses "Brave the Dark," an intense film about a teacher helping a student with a deeply traumatic past. The movie review takes a sharp turn into reality when one of the hosts reveals he has a startlingly similar backstory of homelessness and teacher intervention. Its a heartfelt look at the life-changing power of empathy that quickly becomes a game of "wait, this actually happened to you?".

The big supernatural mystery turns out to be a baffling combination of a regular "punk kid" villain and the brother's protective spirit from the future. The movie was so unscary that the hosts shared their own spooky encounters, which were less "The Conjuring" and more "The Case of the Mysterious Backyard Beer Cans."

item.title: Episode 106 - One Of Them Days
item.description: What happens when the rent money gets spent on a questionable t-shirt business? The Cinema IRL podcast breaks down "One of Them Days," a film where best friends Drew and Alisa embark on a frantic, chaotic scramble to avoid eviction. Their day spirals into a series of hilariously poor decisions, including selling blood and accidentally stealing from a local gangster. Ultimately, their evicted belongings become an impromptu, and surprisingly successful, pop-up art show, proving that sometimes hitting rock bottom comes with a creative twist.

item.title: Episode 105 - Wolf Man
item.description: Ever wonder if Hollywood gets werewolves right? The Cinema IRL podcast tackles the movie Wolfman with a very special guest expert: Morty, werewolf who's here to fact-check the film. Morty sets the record straight on everything from the agonizing pain of transformation to debunking the myth about silver bullets. Tune in to hear a real lycanthrope's take on his cinematic representation, including the very important question of whether you lose the ability to write a grocery list post-transformation.

Tune in to hear a real lycanthrope's take on his cinematic representation, including the very important question of whether you lose the ability to write a grocery list post-transformation.
